description: From Middle English purloynen (“to remove”), borrowed from Anglo-Norman purloigner (“to put far away”), one of the variants of Old French porloignier. Doublet of prolong.

verbs.description: purloin (third-person singular simple present purloins, present participle purloining, simple past and past participle purloined)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To take the property of another, often in breach of trust; to appropriate wrongfully; to steal.
